content:
I think I'll try out a Split-Complementary harmony scheme for my painting. I like the idea of using a bold, vibrant color and its split-complementary colors to create a sense of contrast and energy. I'm thinking of using a blue-green color as my central color, and then pairing it with its split-complementary colors, orange-red and yellow-orange. I want to make sure I use these colors in a way that will really pop and capture the energy of the city.

Can you give me some tips on how to use these colors effectively in my painting? For example, how can I use the blue-green color to create a sense of atmosphere and mood, and how can I use the orange-red and yellow-orange colors to add contrast and energy to the painting?
